intro: Lagenocarpus inversus, commonly known as the upside-down plant, is a unique member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive inflorescence, where the flowers are oriented downward, giving it its common name. The plant is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The fruit is a capsule that opens to release its seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
